intro: Cynanchica pedicellata, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed or butterfly milkweed, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a latex sap that is milky and can be toxic to animals and humans. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological settings.
